intro: Mikaniopsis rwandensis, commonly known as the Rwandan milkweed, is a flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of Rwanda. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae, which includes many species with milky sap. The plant features slender, erect stems and small, clustered leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Its flowers are typically yellow or orange, with five petals and a distinctive corona. Mikaniopsis rwandensis is adapted to cool, moist environments and plays a role in local ecosystems by providing nectar for pollinators.
